CVE-2024-22513 LOW djangorestframework-simplejwt: information disclosure vulnerability djangorestframework-simplejwt version 5.3.1 and before is vulnerable to information disclosure. A user can access web application resources even after their account has been disabled due to missing user validation checks via the for_user method.

CVE-2024-53861 LOW pyjwt: Issuer field partial matches allowed in pyjwt pyjwt is a JSON Web Token implementation in Python. An incorrect string comparison is run for `iss` checking, resulting in `"acb"` being accepted for `"_abc_"`. This is a bug introduced in version 2.10.0: checking the "iss" claim changed from `isinstance(issuer, list)` to `isinstance(issuer, Sequence)`. Since str is a Sequnce, but not a list, `in` is also used for string comparison. This results in `if "abc" not in "__abcd__":` being checked instead of `if "abc" != "__abc__":`. Signature checks are still present so real world impact is likely limited to denial of service scenarios. This issue has been patched in version 2.10.1. All users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability. 2.10.1 
{
  "CVSS": {
    "ghsa": {
      "V3Score": 2.2,
      "V3Vector": "CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N"
    },
    "redhat": {
      "V3Score": 2.2,
      "V3Vector": "CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L"
    }
  },
  "CweIDs": [
    "CWE-697"
  ],
  "DataSource": {
    "ID": "ghsa",
    "Name": "GitHub Security Advisory pip",
    "URL": "https://github.com/advisories?query=type%3Areviewed+ecosystem%3Apip"
  },
  "Description": "pyjwt is a JSON Web Token implementation in Python. An incorrect string comparison is run for `iss` checking, resulting in `\"acb\"` being accepted for `\"_abc_\"`. This is a bug introduced in version 2.10.0: checking the \"iss\" claim changed from `isinstance(issuer, list)` to `isinstance(issuer, Sequence)`. Since str is a Sequnce, but not a list, `in` is also used for string comparison. This results in `if \"abc\" not in \"__abcd__\":` being checked instead of `if \"abc\" != \"__abc__\":`. Signature checks are still present so real world impact is likely limited to denial of service scenarios. This issue has been patched in version 2.10.1. All users are advised to upgrade. Dockerfile (config)

Tipo: dockerfile

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
DS005 ADD instead of COPY You should use COPY instead of ADD unless you want to extract a tar file. Note that an ADD command will extract a tar file, which adds the risk of Zip-based vulnerabilities. Accordingly, it is advised to use a COPY command, which does not extract tar files. LOW Use COPY instead of ADD
  • Message: Consider using 'COPY odbcinst.ini /etc/' command instead of 'ADD odbcinst.ini /etc/'
  • Provider: Dockerfile
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    14: ADD odbcinst.ini /etc/

DS026 No HEALTHCHECK defined You should add HEALTHCHECK instruction in your docker container images to perform the health check on running containers. LOW Add HEALTHCHECK instruction in Dockerfile
  • Message: Add HEALTHCHECK instruction in your Dockerfile

DS029 'apt-get' missing '--no-install-recommends' 'apt-get' install should use '--no-install-recommends' to minimize image size. HIGH Add '--no-install-recommends' flag to 'apt-get'
  • Message: '--no-install-recommends' flag is missed: 'apt-get update && ACCEPT_EULA=Y apt-get -y install mssql-tools msodbcsql17'
  • Provider: Dockerfile
  • Service: general

KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-worker-dev
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest
20:         command: ['celery', '-A', 'fake', 'worker', '-l', 'INFO']
21:         ports:
22:         - containerPort: 5000
23:         resources:
24:           requests:

26:           limits:

KSV011 CPU not limited Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion. LOW Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-worker-dev
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest

23:         resources:
24:           requests:

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-worker-dev

21:         ports:

23:         resources:

25:               memory: "700Mi"
26:           limits:

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-worker-dev
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest
20:         command: ['celery', '-A', 'fake', 'worker', '-l', 'INFO']
21:         ports:
22:         - containerPort: 5000
23:         resources:
24:           requests:
25:               memory: "700Mi"
26:           limits:
27: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-dev' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000

  • Service: general

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-worker-dev

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "fakeapp-celery-worker-dev" of deployment "fakeapp-celery-worker-dev" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

src/kubernetes/dev_collectstatic_job.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    13:       - name: collectstatic
14:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest
15:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
16:         args:
17:         - |
18:                     python3 manage.py collectstatic --no-input
19:         workingDir: /opt/backend
20:         env: 
21:           -
22: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: collectstatic",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: collectstatic",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 13,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest",

        "Truncated": false

        "Annotation": "",

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    13:       - name: collectstatic
14:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest
15:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
16:         args:

20:         env: 
21:           -

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    13:       - name: collectstatic
14:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest
15:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
16:         args:
17:         - |
18:                     python3 manage.py collectstatic --no-input
19:         workingDir: /opt/backend
20:         env: 
21:           -

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    13:       - name: collectstatic
14:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest

KSV016 Memory requests not specified When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.memory'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'resources.requests.memory'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "collectstatic" of job "collectstatic-job" in "development-env" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    13:       - name: collectstatic
14:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest
15:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
16:         args:
17:         - |
18:                     python3 manage.py collectstatic --no-input

        "Truncated": false

      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        env: ",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33menv\u001b[0m: ",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 20,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "          -",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "          -",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": true,
        "Number": 21,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "IsCause": false,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 22,
        "Truncated": true
      }
    ]
  },
  "EndLine": 294,
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general",
  "StartLine": 13
}

src/kubernetes/dev_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-dev' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-dev
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest
20:         ports:
21:         - containerPort: 5000
22:         resources:
23:           requests:
24:               memory: "700Mi"
25:           limits:
26:             memory: "1400Mi"

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-dev' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-dev' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-dev' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-dev
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest
20:         ports:
21:         - containerPort: 5000
22:         resources:
23:           requests:
24:               memory: "700Mi"

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-dev' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-dev
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest
20:         ports:
21:         - containerPort: 5000
22:         resources:
23:           requests:
24:               memory: "700Mi"
25:           limits:
26:             memory: "1400Mi"
27: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",

        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 18,

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-dev' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "fakeapp-backend-dev" of deployment "fakeapp-backend-dev" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

src/kubernetes/dev_flower_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-flower-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-flower-dev' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-flower-dev
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest
20:         command: ['celery', 'flower', '-A', 'fake']
21:         ports:
22:         - containerPort: 5555
23:         resources:
24:           requests:
25:               memory: "700Mi"
26:           limits:
27: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: fakeapp-celery-flower-dev",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: fakeapp-celery-flower-dev",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 18,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-flower-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-flower-dev' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'

  • Service: general

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-flower-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-flower-dev' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-flower-dev
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_dev:latest
20:         command: ['celery', 'flower', '-A', 'fake']

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-flower-dev' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-flower-dev' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "fakeapp-celery-flower-dev" of deployment "fakeapp-celery-flower-dev" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null

  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

src/kubernetes/dev_nginx_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-dev' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        - name: nginx",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "        - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: nginx",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "          image: nginx:1.21.1",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "          \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: nginx:1.21.1",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 17,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-dev' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV011 CPU not limited Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion. LOW Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-dev' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'

  • Service: general

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-dev' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-dev' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-dev' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV018 Memory not limited Enforcing memory limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion. LOW Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.memory'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-dev' should set 'resources.limits.memory'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        - name: nginx",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "        - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: nginx",

        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false

        "Annotation": "",

        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "          \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: nginx:1.21.1",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 17,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "          ports:",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "          \u001b[38;5;33mports\u001b[0m:",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 18,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "            - containerPort: 80",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "            - \u001b[38;5;33mcontainerPort\u001b[0m: \u001b[38;5;37m80",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-dev' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "nginx" of deployment "fake-nginx-dev" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx

18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80

KSV117 Prevent binding to privileged ports The ports which are lower than 1024 receive and transmit various sensitive and privileged data. Allowing containers to use them can bring serious implications. HIGH Do not map the container ports to privileged host ports when starting a container.
  • Message: deployment fake-nginx-dev in default namespace should not set spec.template.spec.containers.ports.containerPort to less than 1024
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}

src/kubernetes/dev_pvolumen_flower_fs.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Tipo: kubernetes

src/kubernetes/dev_redis_client.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'redis-web-client' of Deployment 'redis-web-client-deployment' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis-web-client
17:         image: marian/rebrow
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 5001
20:         env:
21:         - name: REDIS_HOST
22:           value: redis-service
23:         - name: REDIS_PORT
24:           value: "6379"

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'redis-web-client' of Deployment 'redis-web-client-deployment' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

  "Service": "general",
  "StartLine": 16
}
KSV011 CPU not limited Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion. LOW Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'redis-web-client' of Deployment 'redis-web-client-deployment' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis-web-client
17:         image: marian/rebrow
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 5001

22:           value: redis-service
23:         - name: REDIS_PORT
24:           value: "6379"

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
  • Message: Container 'redis-web-client' of Deployment 'redis-web-client-deployment' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

19:         - containerPort: 5001

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'redis-web-client' of Deployment 'redis-web-client-deployment' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis-web-client
17:         image: marian/rebrow
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 5001
20:         env:
21:         - name: REDIS_HOST
22:           value: redis-service
23:         - name: REDIS_PORT
24:           value: "6379"

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'redis-web-client' of Deployment 'redis-web-client-deployment' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis-web-client
17:         image: marian/rebrow
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 5001
20:         env:
21:         - name: REDIS_HOST
22:           value: redis-service
23:         - name: REDIS_PORT
24:           value: "6379"

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'redis-web-client' of Deployment 'redis-web-client-deployment' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'

KSV018 Memory not limited Enforcing memory limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion. LOW Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.memory'.
  • Message: Container 'redis-web-client' of Deployment 'redis-web-client-deployment' should set 'resources.limits.memory'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis-web-client
17:         image: marian/rebrow

19:         - containerPort: 5001

24:           value: "6379"

        "Truncated": false

        "Content": "        image: marian/rebrow",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: marian/rebrow",

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'redis-web-client' of Deployment 'redis-web-client-deployment' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis-web-client
17:         image: marian/rebrow
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 5001
20:         env:
21:         - name: REDIS_HOST
22:           value: redis-service
23:         - name: REDIS_PORT
24:           value: "6379"

KSV021 Runs with GID <= 10000 Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'redis-web-client' of Deployment 'redis-web-client-deployment' should set 'securityContext.runAsGroup' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis-web-client
17:         image: marian/rebrow
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 5001
20:         env:
21:         - name: REDIS_HOST
22:           value: redis-service
23:         - name: REDIS_PORT
24:           value: "6379"

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "redis-web-client" of deployment "redis-web-client-deployment" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis-web-client
17:         image: marian/rebrow
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 5001
20:         env:
21:         - name: REDIS_HOST
22:           value: redis-service
23:         - name: REDIS_PORT
24:           value: "6379"

src/kubernetes/dev_redis_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {

        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,

        "LastCause": false,

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV011 CPU not limited Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion. LOW Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: redis",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: redis",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 17,
        "Truncated": false

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: redis",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: redis",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'

  • Service: general

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "redis" of deployment "redis-deployment" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{

src/kubernetes/dev_secrets_akv.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

src/kubernetes/prod_collectstatic_job.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
12:         args:
13:         - |
14:           pwd &&
15:           ls &&
16:           python3 manage.py collectstatic          
17:         workingDir: /opt/backend
18: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: collectstatic",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: collectstatic",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 9,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest",

        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mcommand\u001b[0m: [\u001b[38;5;37m\"/bin/sh\"\u001b[0m, \u001b[38;5;37m\"-c\"\u001b[0m]",

        "Number": 11,

        "Number": 12,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",

        "Truncated": false

        "Truncated": false

        "IsCause": false,

        "Number": 18,
        "Truncated": true
      }

  },
  "EndLine": 126,
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general",
  "StartLine": 9
}
KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
12:         args:
13:         - |
14:           pwd &&
15:           ls &&
16:           python3 manage.py collectstatic          
17:         workingDir: /opt/backend
18:

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
12:         args:
13:         - |
14:           pwd &&
15:           ls &&
16:           python3 manage.py collectstatic          
17:         workingDir: /opt/backend
18:

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
12:         args:

14:           pwd &&
15:           ls &&
16:           python3 manage.py collectstatic          
17:         workingDir: /opt/backend

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest

KSV016 Memory requests not specified When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.memory'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'resources.requests.memory'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
12:         args:
13:         - |
14:           pwd &&
15:           ls &&
16:           python3 manage.py collectstatic          
17:         workingDir: /opt/backend
18: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: collectstatic",

KSV018 Memory not limited Enforcing memory limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion. LOW Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.memory'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'resources.limits.memory'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "collectstatic" of job "collectstatic-job" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
12:         args:
13:         - |

src/kubernetes/prod_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-prod' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-prod' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-prod
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
20:         ports:
21:         - containerPort: 5000
22:         resources:
23:           requests:
24:               memory: "700Mi"
25:           limits:
26:             memory: "1400Mi"
27: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-prod' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-prod' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-prod
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
20:         ports:

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-prod' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-prod' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-prod
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
20:         ports:
21:         - containerPort: 5000
22:         resources:

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-prod' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-prod' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-prod
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
20:         ports:

22:         resources:

26:             memory: "1400Mi"

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-prod' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-prod' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-prod
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
20:         ports:
21:         - containerPort: 5000
22:         resources:
23:           requests:
24:               memory: "700Mi"
25:           limits:
26:             memory: "1400Mi"
27: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: fakeapp-backend-prod",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: fakeapp-backend-prod",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-prod' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-prod' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-prod
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
20:         ports:

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "fakeapp-backend-prod" of deployment "fakeapp-backend-prod" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-prod
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend:latest
20:         ports:

src/kubernetes/prod_nginx_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-prod' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-prod' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        - name: nginx",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "        - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: nginx",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",

KSV011 CPU not limited Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion. LOW Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-prod' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-prod' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-prod' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-prod' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-prod' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        - name: nginx",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "        - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: nginx",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "          image: nginx:1.21.1",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "          \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: nginx:1.21.1",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 17,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "          ports:",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "          \u001b[38;5;33mports\u001b[0m:",

        "Number": 18,
        "Truncated": false

KSV021 Runs with GID <= 10000 Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-prod' should set 'securityContext.runAsGroup' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "nginx" of deployment "fake-nginx-prod" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx

KSV117 Prevent binding to privileged ports The ports which are lower than 1024 receive and transmit various sensitive and privileged data. Allowing containers to use them can bring serious implications. HIGH Do not map the container ports to privileged host ports when starting a container.
  • Message: deployment fake-nginx-prod in default namespace should not set spec.template.spec.containers.ports.containerPort to less than 1024
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}

src/kubernetes/prod_pvolumen_fs.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

src/kubernetes/prod_redis_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: redis",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: redis",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 17,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        ports:",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mports\u001b[0m:",

        "LastCause": false,

        "Truncated": false
      },

        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": true,

      }

  "EndLine": 19,
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general",
  "StartLine": 16
}
KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: redis",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: redis",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 17,
        "Truncated": false

        "Content": "        ports:",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mports\u001b[0m:",

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
