KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "redis" of deployment "redis-deployment" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

src/kubernetes/prod_secrets_akv.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

src/kubernetes/qa_autoscaler_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

src/kubernetes/qa_celery_worker.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-worker-qa
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
20:         command: ['celery', '-A', 'fake', 'worker', '-l', 'INFO']
21:         ports:
22:         - containerPort: 5000
23:         resources:
24:           requests:
25:               memory: "700Mi"
26:           limits:

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV011 CPU not limited Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion. LOW Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-worker-qa
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
20:         command: ['celery', '-A', 'fake', 'worker', '-l', 'INFO']
21:         ports:
22:         - containerPort: 5000
23:         resources:
24:           requests:
25:               memory: "700Mi"
26:           limits:

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-worker-qa
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest

21:         ports:
22:         - containerPort: 5000
23:         resources:
24:           requests:
25:               memory: "700Mi"
26:           limits:

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-worker-qa' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-worker-qa

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "fakeapp-celery-worker-qa" of deployment "fakeapp-celery-worker-qa" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

src/kubernetes/qa_collectstatic_job.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
12:         args:
13:         - |
14:           pwd &&
15:           ls &&
16:           python3 manage.py collectstatic          
17:         workingDir: /opt/backend
18:

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
12:         args:
13:         - |
14:           pwd &&
15:           ls &&
16:           python3 manage.py collectstatic          
17:         workingDir: /opt/backend
18: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: collectstatic",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: collectstatic",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,

KSV011 CPU not limited Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion. LOW Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
12:         args:
13:         - |
14:           pwd &&
15:           ls &&
16:           python3 manage.py collectstatic          
17:         workingDir: /opt/backend

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
12:         args:
13:         - |
14:           pwd &&
15:           ls &&
16:           python3 manage.py collectstatic          
17:         workingDir: /opt/backend
18:

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]
12:         args:
13:         - |
14:           pwd &&
15:           ls &&
16:           python3 manage.py collectstatic          
17:         workingDir: /opt/backend
18:

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

KSV016 Memory requests not specified When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.memory'.
  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'resources.requests.memory'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]

{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {

  • Message: Container 'collectstatic' of Job 'collectstatic-job' should set 'resources.limits.memory'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "collectstatic" of job "collectstatic-job" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    9:       - name: collectstatic
10:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
11:         command: ["/bin/sh", "-c"]

src/kubernetes/qa_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-qa' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-qa
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
20:         ports:
21:         - containerPort: 5000
22:         resources:
23:           requests:
24:               memory: "700Mi"
25:           limits:
26:             memory: "2400Mi"
27: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: fakeapp-backend-qa",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: fakeapp-backend-qa",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 18,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 19,

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-qa' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-qa
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
20:         ports:

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-qa' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-qa
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
20:         ports:
21:         - containerPort: 5000

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-qa' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-qa

20:         ports:

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-qa' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-qa
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
20:         ports:
21:         - containerPort: 5000
22:         resources:
23:           requests:
24:               memory: "700Mi"
25:           limits:
26:             memory: "2400Mi"
27: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: fakeapp-backend-qa",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: fakeapp-backend-qa",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 18,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 19,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-backend-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-backend-qa' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-backend-qa
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
20:         ports:

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "fakeapp-backend-qa" of deployment "fakeapp-backend-qa" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

src/kubernetes/qa_flower_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-flower-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-flower-qa' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-flower-qa
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
20:         command: ['celery', 'flower', '-A', 'fake']
21:         ports:
22:         - containerPort: 5555
23:         resources:
24:           requests:
25:               memory: "700Mi"
26:           limits:
27:

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-flower-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-flower-qa' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-flower-qa

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-flower-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-flower-qa' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    18:       - name: fakeapp-celery-flower-qa
19:         image: fakeappcr.azurecr.io/fake_backend_qa:latest
20:         command: ['celery', 'flower', '-A', 'fake']

23:         resources:

25:               memory: "700Mi"

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-flower-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-flower-qa' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'fakeapp-celery-flower-qa' of Deployment 'fakeapp-celery-flower-qa' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "fakeapp-celery-flower-qa" of deployment "fakeapp-celery-flower-qa" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

src/kubernetes/qa_nginx_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-qa' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-qa' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV011 CPU not limited Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion. LOW Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-qa' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

23:               readOnly: true

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-qa' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

23:               readOnly: true

KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-qa' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-qa' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-qa' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        - name: nginx",
        "FirstCause": true,

KSV021 Runs with GID <= 10000 Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'nginx' of Deployment 'fake-nginx-qa' should set 'securityContext.runAsGroup' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80
20:           volumeMounts:
21:             - name: config-volume
22:               mountPath: /etc/nginx/conf.d
23:               readOnly: true

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "nginx" of deployment "fake-nginx-qa" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:         - name: nginx
17:           image: nginx:1.21.1
18:           ports:
19:             - containerPort: 80

KSV117 Prevent binding to privileged ports The ports which are lower than 1024 receive and transmit various sensitive and privileged data. Allowing containers to use them can bring serious implications. HIGH Do not map the container ports to privileged host ports when starting a container.
  • Message: deployment fake-nginx-qa in default namespace should not set spec.template.spec.containers.ports.containerPort to less than 1024
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}

src/kubernetes/qa_pvolumen_fs.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

src/kubernetes/qa_redis_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment-qa' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV013 Image tag ":latest" used It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version. MEDIUM Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment-qa' should specify an image tag
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: redis",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: redis",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {

        "Content": "        image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",

        "LastCause": false,

  "Service": "general",
  "StartLine": 16
}
KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment-qa' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: redis",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: redis",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 17,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        ports:",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mports\u001b[0m:",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 18,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        - containerPort: 6379",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        - \u001b[38;5;33mcontainerPort\u001b[0m: \u001b[38;5;37m6379",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": true,
        "Number": 19,

  "Service": "general",
  "StartLine": 16
}
KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment-qa' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment-qa' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "redis" of deployment "redis-deployment-qa" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis/redis-stack-server:latest
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",

        "LastCause": false,

        "Truncated": false

        "Annotation": "",

        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: redis/redis-stack-server:latest",

src/kubernetes/qa_secrets_akv.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

src/kubernetes/redis_deployment.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

  "Code": {

        "LastCause": false,

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

        "Number": 19,
        "Truncated": false
      }
    ]
  },
  "EndLine": 19,
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general",
  "StartLine": 16
}
KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: redis",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: redis",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: redis:5.0.7-alpine",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: redis:5.0.7-alpine",

        "LastCause": false,

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine
18:         ports:

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "redis" of deployment "redis-deployment" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

src/kubernetes/redis_deployment_qa.yaml (config)

Tipo: kubernetes

Misconfiguraciones

IDTítuloDescripciónSeverityResolución DetalleCauseMetadata
KSV001 Can elevate its own privileges A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node. MEDIUM Set 'set containers[].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to 'false'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment-qa' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV003 Default capabilities: some containers do not drop all The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution. LOW Add 'ALL' to containers[].securityContext.capabilities.drop.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment-qa' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

KSV012 Runs as root user Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges. MEDIUM Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment-qa' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

  "Code": {
    "Lines": [

        "Content": "        - containerPort: 6379",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        - \u001b[38;5;33mcontainerPort\u001b[0m: \u001b[38;5;37m6379",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": true,
        "Number": 19,
        "Truncated": false
      }
    ]
  },
  "EndLine": 19,
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general",
  "StartLine": 16
}
KSV014 Root file system is not read-only An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk. HIGH Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment-qa' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379
 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": [
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "      - name: redis",
        "FirstCause": true,
        "Highlighted": "      - \u001b[38;5;33mname\u001b[0m: redis",
        "IsCause": true,
        "LastCause": false,
        "Number": 16,
        "Truncated": false
      },
      {
        "Annotation": "",
        "Content": "        image: redis:5.0.7-alpine",
        "FirstCause": false,
        "Highlighted": "        \u001b[38;5;33mimage\u001b[0m: redis:5.0.7-alpine",

KSV015 CPU requests not specified When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention. LOW Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment-qa' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general

KSV020 Runs with UID <= 10000 Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table. LOW Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.
  • Message: Container 'redis' of Deployment 'redis-deployment-qa' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines:

17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine

KSV030 Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles. LOW Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.
  • Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

KSV104 Seccomp policies disabled A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies. MEDIUM Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards
  • Message: container "redis" of deployment "redis-deployment-qa" in "default" namespace should specify a seccomp profile
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
{
  "Code": {
    "Lines": null
  },
  "Provider": "Kubernetes",
  "Service": "general"
}
KSV106 Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability. LOW Set 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop' to 'ALL' and only add 'NET_BIND_SERVICE' to 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add'.
  • Message: container should drop all
  • Provider: Kubernetes
  • Service: general
  • Code Lines: 
    16:       - name: redis
17:         image: redis:5.0.7-alpine
18:         ports:
19:         - containerPort: 6379

.env (secret)

Tipo:

Secrets

Rule IDCategoríaSeverityTítuloInicioFinMatchCódigoCauseMetadata
github-pat GitHub CRITICAL GitHub Personal Access Token 3 3 GIT_TOKEN=****************************************
  • Línea 1: 
    # Settings
  • Línea 2: 
    DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=fake.settings.api
  • Línea 3: 
    GIT_TOKEN=****************************************
  • Línea 4: 
    MODEL_VERSION=development
  • Línea 1: 
    {'Number': 1, 'Content': '# Settings', 'IsCause': False, 'Annotation': '', 'Truncated': False, 'Highlighted': '# Settings', 'FirstCause': False, 'LastCause': False}
  • Línea 2: 
    {'Number': 2, 'Content': 'DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=fake.settings.api', 'IsCause': False, 'Annotation': '', 'Truncated': False, 'Highlighted': 'DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=fake.settings.api', 'FirstCause': False, 'LastCause': False}
  • Línea 3: 
    {'Number': 3, 'Content': 'GIT_TOKEN=****************************************', 'IsCause': True, 'Annotation': '', 'Truncated': False, 'Highlighted': 'GIT_TOKEN=****************************************', 'FirstCause': True, 'LastCause': True}
  • Línea 4: 
    {'Number': 4, 'Content': 'MODEL_VERSION=development', 'IsCause': False, 'Annotation': '', 'Truncated': False, 'Highlighted': 'MODEL_VERSION=development', 'FirstCause': False, 'LastCause': False}
    		•
